p: We conclude that CD34+ cell function improves post saxagliptin therapy compared to a matched placebo in an early onset type 2 diabetes population that did not have any known cardiovascular disease or complications. We believe CD34+ cells can act as a valuable biomarker for assessment of endothelial function, in a setting of diabetes and can help provide valuable information using cellular data, to support or refute findings from other cardiovascular outcome trials in diabetes [ 44, 58â€“ 60].
